result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by Patricia Sommer of Subpoena's - original filed in 14CF151
Motion hearing on September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dylan J Raikowski not in court. Atty Sommer is present. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases: 14CF151, 15CF261, and 15CM299. Atty Sommer informs the Court that without her client present, she is not able to present her case today on her evidentary motion. Court reschedules.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Identification of Submitted Document
Postconviction Motion to Withdraw Plea Due to Ineffective Assistance of Counsel
Hearing on June 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Postconviction Motion to Withdraw Plea Due to Ineffective Assistance of Counsel
Identification of Submitted Document

Defendant Dylan J Raikowski in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-299, 15CF-261 and 14CF-151.

10:34 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing today.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Atty Halverson has communicated all plea agreements with Defendant.
Atty Halverson is appearing on behalf of Atty Renc for today's hearing.
Atty Halverson has addressed potential immigration conditions with Defendant.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding the plea agreement.

14CF-151: Has been resolved already by VIP
State requests that VIP to be revoked, enter judgment of conviction, find Defendant guilty of Count 2
Defendant did not comply with VIP

BY THE COURT:
Court will revoke plea and find Defendant GUILTY on Count 2 in 14CF-151 and order Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record

15CF-261:
State has filed an amended criminal complaint to misdemeanor bailjumping. Defendant will enter plea.

15CM-299:
File would be dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes

Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2 14CF-151
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 15CF-261

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-151: Count 2 Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct 
15CF-261: Misdemeanor Bailjumping 946.49(1)(a)
15CM-299: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-151:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 30 days, imposed and stayed
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge
Perform 10 hours of community service
Do not possess/consume any controlled substances except medications prescribed by a treating physician
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Continue with AODA counseling as counselor recommends
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
May be eligible for early discharge after 12 months, if agent recommends and once Defendant completes conditions of supervision

15CF-261:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 days, imposes and stayed, Concurrent to 14CF-151
Probation for a period of 18 Months, Concurrent to 14CF-151
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-151
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
May be eligible for early discharge after 12 months, if agent recommends and once Defendant completes conditions of supervision
Plea hearing at 10-14-2015 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 09-21-2015 11:15 am
Following 15CF261.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 11:15 am.
